title: Police: DUI-related crash kills 1, injures 2 in Caldwell
title_page: Police: DUI-related crash kills 1, injures 2 in Caldwell
maintext:
CALDWELL, Idaho (AP) — A Nampa, Idaho man was charged after a fatal crash that killed one woman and injured two other people in Caldwell.
Grayson Thurston, 20, was charged with suspicion of felony vehicular manslaughter and felony aggravated driving under the influence, the Idaho Statesman reported Monday.
Thurston’s Dodge Ram pickup truck collided with 37-year-old Janet Gonzalez, who was driving a Mitsubishi in the same direction on Sunday, the Idaho State Police said.
Gonzalez died at the scene and two passengers in her vehicle were transferred to separate medical centers by ground ambulance, authorities said. Further information about their conditions were not available.
Police interviewed Thurston at a hospital in Nampa where he allegedly admitted to drinking two shots of rum at a friend’s house before driving, authorities said. He was taken into police custody after being medically cleared by the hospital.
Thurston has not yet had the opportunity to enter a plea, and the Canyon County Public Defender’s office said his case has not yet been assigned to an attorney.
